scenario:
Schlumberger (SLB) reported Q4 2024 results that exceeded Wall Street's consensus expectations. Key financial metrics include:

- Non-GAAP earnings per share: $0.92, outperforming the projected $0.90
- Revenue: $9.28 billion, surpassing the $9.18 billion estimate
- Adjusted EBITDA: $2.38 billion, up 5.1% year over year
- Free cash flow: $1.63 billion, up 1.9% year over year

The company's business overview emphasizes three growth engines: Core, Digital, and New Energy. Schlumberger has focused on energy transition, decarbonization, and technology innovation, with a focus on digital solutions and sustainable energy advancements.

Quarterly highlights include:

- Digital & Integration division revenue growth of 6% sequentially and 10% year over year
- 4% sequential and 7% year-over-year growth in North America, attributed to rising digital sales and activity in the Gulf of Mexico
- 3% decline in revenue in Latin America, primarily influenced by reduced drilling operations in Mexico

The company has raised its quarterly dividend by 3.6% to $0.285 per share and increased its share buyback authorization to a minimum of $4 billion this year.

Looking ahead, Schlumberger expects continued momentum driven by strategic focus on digital growth and energy transition efforts, with strong EBITDA margins and low to mid-single digit international spending growth in 2025.
